posts.post_content: @Rav0004: Ooo, an aura with split second, why didn't I think of that? I like it. I still think it's silly that while auras are inherent card disadvantage, 1) some attempts to fix that have made arguably broken cards like [Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor) and [Aspect of Mongoose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aspect of Mongoose), and 2) many players who know better (such as myself) love them anyway. While you can still get 2-for-1'd when your aura with totem armor is on the stack, I think the mechanic was a good step towards helping make auras not so pitifully weak compared to equipment. This card is another good step in that direction. Reminds me of [Neurok Stealthsuit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Neurok Stealthsuit), if, again, weaker than equipment.
posts.html:
@Rav0004: Ooo, an aura with split second, why didn't I think of that? I like it. I still think it's silly that while auras are inherent card disadvantage, 1) some attempts to fix that have made arguably broken cards like Rancor and Aspect of Mongoose, and 2) many players who know better (such as myself) love them anyway. While you can still get 2-for-1'd when your aura with totem armor is on the stack, I think the mechanic was a good step towards helping make auras not so pitifully weak compared to equipment. This card is another good step in that direction. Reminds me of Neurok Stealthsuit, if, again, weaker than equipment.

posts.post_content:
TrollForever, I hope you can find something to fill the hole in your life that drives you to look for attention any way you can get it. Well, you have our attention. Does your daddy not love you any more? Do you get bullied? Depressed? What's the problem? I will listen.   
  
This is an aura that has 2 different ways to combat removal to preserve your card advantage, and it gain's you life. As far as auras go, isn't this a really good one? This seem like it could make a [Sun Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sun Titan) a real pain to get rid of, especially if you have a [Greater Auramancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Greater Auramancy) or 2 on the table.   
  
Auras may not be the best, but they sure can be FUN.
